value.title: How blockchain and machine learning can deliver the promise of omnichannel marketing
value.excerpt: Researchers from University of Minnesota, New York University, University of Pennsylvania, BI Norwegian Business School, University of Michigan, National Bureau of Economic Research, and University of North Carolina published a new paper in the Journal of Marketing that examines how advances in machine learning (ML) and blockchain can address inherent frictions in omnichannel marketing and raises many questions for practice and research.

value.title: Solving 'barren plateaus' is the key to quantum machine learning
value.excerpt: Many machine learning algorithms on quantum computers suffer from the dreaded "barren plateau" of unsolvability, where they run into dead ends on optimization problems. This challenge had been relatively unstudied—until now.

value.title: Oracle is making its cloud databases easier to use
value.excerpt: Oracle says the latest release of its cloud-based Autonomous Data Warehouse will help transform complex data transformation activities into point-and-click tasks. The Oracle Autonomous Data Warehouse is a software-as-a-service cloud data warehouse that Oracle says is designed to reduce the complexities of developing data driven applications by automating critical provisioning and configuration tasks.

value.title: Oracle brings Autonomous Data Warehouse to the rest of us
value.excerpt: The broadened service includes drag and drop data loading, data cleansing, data transformation, data modeling tools, and AutoML tools for business analysts and citizen data scientists. It also includes a rudimentary data catalog for data discovery.

value.title: Machine learning can identify cancerous cells by their acidity
value.excerpt: Cancerous cells exhibit several key differences from healthy cells that help identify them as dangerous. For instance, the pH—the level of acidity—within a cancerous cell is not the same as the pH within a healthy cell.
